triples.name: Autonomous underwater vehicle
triples.relevance: AUVs are the primary technology subject of this survey on multi-AUV formation control.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: Formation control is fundamentally rooted in control theory principles for managing multi-agent systems.

triples.name: Underwater acoustic communication
triples.relevance: Communication capability through underwater acoustic methods is essential for coordinating AUV formations.

triples.name: Control system
triples.relevance: Formation control systems apply feedback and distributed control principles to coordinate multiple AUVs.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Multi-AUV formation is fundamentally a multi-agent system coordinating autonomous vehicles to achieve collective tasks.

triples.name: Hydrographic survey
triples.relevance: Hydrographic surveys are a key application domain where multi-AUV formations provide improved efficiency and stability.
